metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000158 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
CPython (aka Python) up to 2.7.13 is vulnerable to an integer overflow in the PyString_DecodeEscape function in stringobject.c, resulting in heap-based buffer overflow (and possible arbitrary code execution)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2
No subscription required

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> PyBytes_DecodeEscape() may be affected in Python 3.x versions. Please check. mdeslaur> per upstream bug, 3.6 and 3.7 aren't affected

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.2').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4').
